Sentencas: A two dimensional model is developed to study the transport and reaction processes in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) fueled by partially pre-reformed gas mixture, considering the direct internal reforming (DIR) of methane and water gas shift (WGS) reaction in the porous anode of SOFC.
Titulo: Modeling of SOFC running on partially pre-reformed gas mixture

Sentencas: Electrochemical oxidations of H-2 and CO fuels are both considered.
Titulo: Modeling of SOFC running on partially pre-reformed gas mixture

Sentencas: The model consists of an electrochemical, a chemical model, and a computational fluid dynamics (CFD) model.
Titulo: Modeling of SOFC running on partially pre-reformed gas mixture

Sentencas: Two chemical models are compared to examine their effects on SOFC modeling results.
Titulo: Modeling of SOFC running on partially pre-reformed gas mixture

Sentencas: Different from the previous studies on hydrogen fueled SOFC, higher gas velocity is found to slightly decrease the performance of SOFC running on pre-reformed gas mixture, due to suppressed gas composition variation at a higher gas velocity.
Titulo: Modeling of SOFC running on partially pre-reformed gas mixture

Sentencas: The current density distribution along the gas channels at an inlet temperature of 1173K is quite different from that at 1073K, as DIR reaction is facilitated at a higher temperature.
Titulo: Modeling of SOFC running on partially pre-reformed gas mixture

Sentencas: It is also found that neglecting the electrochemical oxidation of CO can considerably underestimate the total current density of SOFC running on pre-reformed hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Modeling of SOFC running on partially pre-reformed gas mixture

Sentencas: An alternative method is proposed to numerically determine the open-circuit potential of SOFC running on hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Modeling of SOFC running on partially pre-reformed gas mixture

Sentencas: Electrochemical reactions are observed at open-circuit potentials.
Titulo: Modeling of SOFC running on partially pre-reformed gas mixture
